intro: Aruba glandulifera, commonly known as the Aruban glandular tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Aruba. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a waxy texture. Aruba glandulifera is adapted to the arid climate of Aruba, with features that help it conserve water and thrive in sandy soils.
